Values.Name: Gfx10LdsPsGroupSizeNone
Values.Description: Don't share PS attributes across waves.

Values.Name: Gfx10LdsPsGroupSizeDouble
Values.Description: Share PS attributes across two waves.

Settings.Description: Specifies how many PS waves should share the same LDS allocation.  Not supported on all platforms
Settings.Name: LdsPsGroupSize

Values.Name: Gfx10AllowBigPageRenderTarget
Values.Description: Color render targets

Values.Name: Gfx10AllowBigPageDepthStencil
Values.Description: Depth stencil images

Values.Name: Gfx10AllowBigPageShaderWrite
Values.Description: Shader writeable images

Values.Name: Gfx10AllowBigPageShaderRead
Values.Description: Shader readable images

Values.Name: Gfx10AllowBigPageBuffers
Values.Description: Renderable buffers

Settings.Description: Bitmask of cases where big-page will potentially be enabled
Settings.Name: AllowBigPage

Settings.Description: Disables binding of border color palettes, and forces any samplers created to use a transparent black color.
Settings.Name: DisableBorderColorPaletteBinds

Values.Name: Gfx9PrintMetaEquationInfoEquations
Values.Description: Prints meta equations themselves.

Values.Name: Gfx9PrintMetaEquationInfoProcessing
Values.Description: Prints equation coordinates as they're processed.

Settings.Description: Controls printing of meta-equation data.  Debug builds only.
Settings.Name: PrintMetaEquationInfo

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearDisabled
Values.Description: Disable the Optimized Fast Clear Path.

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearColorCmask
Values.Description: Enable Optimized Fast Clear Path for color surfaces cmask metadata fastclear(msaa only).

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearColorDcc
Values.Description: Enable Optimized Fast Clear Path for color surfaces dcc metadata fastclear.

Values.Name: Gfx9OptimizedFastClearDepth
Values.Description: Enable Optimized Fast Clear Path for depth surfaces htile metadata fastclear.

Settings.Description: If enabled, the meta-equations will be processed by an optimized compute shader and algorithm.
Settings.Name: OptimizedFastClear

Values.Name: BlockSize32B
Values.Description: Compressed block size of 32B

Values.Name: BlockSize64B
Values.Description: Compressed block size of 64B

Values.Name: DefaultBlockSize
Values.Description: Default block size for device

Settings.Description: Controls the default DCC_CONTROL.MIN_COMPRESSED_BLOCK_SIZE
Settings.Name: MinDccCompressedBlockSize

Values.Name: DecompressDcc
Values.Description: DCC decompress.

Values.Name: DecompressHtile
Values.Description: Depth expand.

Values.Name: DecompressFmask
Values.Description: FMask decompress.

Values.Name: DecompressFastClear
Values.Description: Fast clear eliminate.

Settings.Description: Controls whether the specified decompress / expand / eliminate operations will always occur when requested.
Settings.Name: AlwaysDecompress

Settings.Description: True to override 1D images to be 2D instead.
Settings.Name: Treat1dAs2d

Values.Name: Gfx10ForceWaveBreakSizeNone
Values.Description: No wave breaks by region.

Values.Name: Gfx10ForceWaveBreakSize8x8
Values.Description: 8x8 region size.

Values.Name: Gfx10ForceWaveBreakSize16x16
Values.Description: 16x16 region size.

Values.Name: Gfx10ForceWaveBreakSize32x32
Values.Description: 32x32 region size.

Values.Name: Gfx10ForceWaveBreakSizeClient
Values.Description: Use client specified value.

Settings.Description: Forces the size of a wave break; over-rides client-specified value.
Settings.Name: ForceWaveBreakSize

Settings.Description: Affects tiled-to-tiled image copies on the GFX10 SDMA engine where both images are compressed Set to true to leave the source image in a compressed state, set to false to leave the dest image in a compressed state.
Settings.Name: SdmaPreferCompressedSource

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingleNone
Values.Description: Use comp-to-reg all image type.

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingle2d
Values.Description: Use comp-to-single for 2d image.

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingle2dArray
Values.Description: Use comp-to-single for 2d array image.

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingleMsaa
Values.Description: Use comp-to-single for MSAA image.

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingle3D
Values.Description: Use comp-to-single for 3d image.

Values.Name: Gfx10DisableCompToReg
Values.Description: If set, comp-to-reg rendering will be disabled for images that were cleared with comp-to-single.

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingle8bpp
Values.Description: If set, use comp-to-single for 8bpp image.

Values.Name: Gfx10UseCompToSingle16bpp
Values.Description: If set, use comp-to-single for 16bpp image.

Settings.Description: Whether we need to set first pixel of each block that corresponds to 1 byte in DCC memory, and don't need to do a fast clear eliminate based on image type.
Settings.Name: UseCompToSingle

Settings.Description: Forces a fast clear code to be the regular clear code and turns off AC01 compression which makes sure the four 'magic' compressed clear codes aren't used.
Settings.Name: ForceRegularClearCode

Values.Name: SlowClearUav
Values.Description: Use a compute pipeline and UAVs

Values.Name: SlowClearRt
Values.Description: Treat clear target as a render target

Settings.Name: Gfx11SlowClearMethod
Settings.Description: Determines whether slow clears should occur as UAVs or render targets.  GFX11 only
GFX11 adds support that allows DCC to always support format replacement
Settings.Name: Gfx11AlwaysAllowDccFormatReplacement

Settings.Description: Controls the value of CB_FDCC_CONTROL.SAMPLE_MASK_TRACKER_WATERMARK.  Valid values are 0 and 3-15
Settings.Name: Gfx11SampleMaskTrackerWatermark

Values.Description: You cannot get rid of the metadata by multiplying by 0. That would cause problems.

Settings.Description: Multiplies the size of the metadata surface by this amount. Metadata surface size works in powers of 2. Non power of 2 multiples might work, but it won't be a value that is actaully returned by addrlib.
Settings.Name: Gfx11MetadataSizeMultiplier

Settings.Description: The final alignment of the metadata will be the result of Max(addrlib DCC alignment, gfx11OverrideMetadataAlignment).
Settings.Name: Gfx11OverrideMetadataAlignment

Settings.Description: Forces use of a graphics fill memory path on command buffers that supports graphics ops
Settings.Name: ForceGraphicsFillMemoryPath

Settings.Description: Controls whether to wait after F/I when changing targets within a Metadata mip tail region. This can resolve corruptions related to metadata cache conflicts.
Settings.Name: WaitOnMetadataMipTail

Values.Name: WaitAfterCbFlush
Values.Description: Wait after CB flush events.

Values.Name: WaitBeforeBarrierEopWithCbFlush
Values.Description: Wait before barrier EOP which includes CB flush.

Values.Name: WaitAfterDbFlush
Values.Description: Wait after DB flush events.

Settings.Description: Bitmask of cases to add waits around F/I events. These options can help to diagnose and potentially workaround some deadlock or corruption issues, although will likely have some performance impact.
Settings.Name: WaitOnFlush

Settings.Description: If true, writes the COLOR_SRC_OPT and COLOR_DST_OPT bits of theSX_MRT#_BLEND_OPT for Blend States.
Settings.Name: BlendOptimizationEnable

Settings.Description: If true, DCC will be used to support fast color clears on singlesampled Color Target Images.
Settings.Name: FastColorClearEnable

Settings.Description: If true, DCC will be used to support fast color clears on singlesampled 3D Color Target Images.
Settings.Name: FastColorClearOn3dEnable

Settings.Description: Controls the setting of the CB_COLOR_INFO.FMASK_COMPRESSION_DISABLE bit.
Settings.Name: FmaskCompressDisable

Settings.Description: If true, allows for non-zero fMask pipe-bank-xor.
Settings.Name: FmaskAllowPipeBankXor

Values.Name: Gfx9DccOnComputeInit
Values.Description: One time init

Values.Name: Gfx9DccOnComputeFastClear
Values.Description: Fast color clear.

Settings.Description: Determines the situations on which a compute shader will be used for DCC access.
Settings.Name: DccOnComputeEnable

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruCmask
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for CMASK

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruDcc
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for DCC

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruFmask
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for FMASK

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruHtile
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for HTILE

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruOcclusion
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for Occlusion

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruDepth
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for Depth. WARNING - Use with caution, can dominate L2.

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruStencil
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for Stencil. WARNING - Use with caution, can dominate L2.

Values.Name: Gfx10CbDbCachePolicyLruColor
Values.Description: Use cache policy LRU for Color. WARNING - NOT RECOMMENDED as it can dominate L2.

Settings.Description: Bitmask of which CB/DB cache policies to follow.
Settings.Name: CbDbCachePolicy

Values.Description: Do not limit number of waves in flight in each compute unit.
Limits the number of waves in flight in each compute unit.

Settings.Description: Controls the WAVES_PER_SH field in the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_LIMITS register; note that it is specified per-CU rather than per-SH for convenience.
Settings.Name: CsMaxWavesPerCu

Values.Description: Disables locking.
CS per-SH low threshold for locking.

Settings.Description: Controls the LOCK_THRESHOLD field in the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_LIMITS register. CS per-SH low threshold for locking.
Settings.Name: CsLockThreshold

Values.Name: CsSimdDestCntlDefault
Values.Description: Keeps the default SIMD_DEST_CNTL behavior.

Values.Name: CsSimdDestCntlForce1
Values.Description: Forces SIMD_DEST_CNTL to 1.

Values.Name: CsSimdDestCntlForce0
Values.Description: Forces SIMD_DEST_CNTL to 0.

Settings.Description: Controls the SIMD_DEST_CNTL field of the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_LIMITS register. By default, this flag is calulated based on the number of waves in the dispatch. If the number of waves is a multiple of 4, this flag is set, otherwise it is cleared.
Settings.Name: CsSimdDestCntl

Values.Name: ColorTransformAuto
Values.Description: Keeps the default COLOR_TRANSFORM behavior.

Values.Name: ColorTransformDisable
Values.Description: Disables COLOR_TRANSFORM behavior.

Settings.Description: Controls the COLOR_TRANSFORM field of the CB_COLOR0_DCC_CONTROL/CB_COLOR0_FDCC_CONTROL register.
Settings.Name: ColorTransform

Settings.Description: Controls the value of the COMPUTE_DISPATCH_INTERLEAVE register. This register governs how many thread groups are sent to one SE before switching to the next one. This setting will override the clients behaviour.

Values.Name: CsDispatchInterleaveSizeHonorClient
Values.Description: Leave the interleave size determination to the client.

Values.Name: OverrideCsDispatchInterleaveSizeDisabled
Values.Description: Disable interleaving (switch after each threadgroup).

Values.Name: OverrideCsDispatchInterleaveSize128
Values.Description: Switch at 128 threads.

Values.Name: OverrideCsDispatchInterleaveSize256
Values.Description: Switch at 256 threads.

Values.Name: OverrideCsDispatchInterleaveSize512
Values.Description: Switch at 512 threads.

Values.Name: OverrideCsDispatchInterleaveSize64
Values.Description: Switch at 64 threads.

Settings.Name: OverrideCsDispatchInterleaveSize

Settings.Description: If true, HTile will be enabled for depth/stencil images.
Settings.Name: HtileEnable

Settings.Description: Toggle between DB_Z_INFO.NUM_SAMPLES = 3 (legacy) and DB_Z_INFO.NUM_SAMPLES = coverage_samples (from MSAA state object)
Settings.Name: UseLegacyDbZInfo

Settings.Description: If set then RB+ is disabled if any color target has blending enabled.  GFX11 specific
Settings.Name: Gfx11DisableRbPlusWithBlending

Settings.Description: If set then implements this GFX11 workaround.  if(BLENDING && pipeline in 1xaa)  OVERRIDE_INTRINSIC_RATE_ENABLE = 1  OVERRIDE_INTRINSIC_RATE = 2 (4xaa) else  OVERRIDE_INTRINSIC_RATE_ENABLE = 0
Settings.Name: WaEnableIntrinsicRateEnable

Settings.Description: If set then disables AC01 (special black and white clear codes)

Values.Name: Ac01WaAllowAc01
Values.Description: The workaround is disabled, PAL uses its normal AC01 fast clear logic.

Values.Name: Ac01WaForbidAc01
Values.Description: The workaround is enabled, AC01 fast clears are forbidden.

Values.Name: Ac01WaPublicSetting
Values.Description: The ValidateSettings function replaces this with one of the first two enums based on the public setting.

Settings.Name: WaDisableAc01

Settings.Description: If true, the ITERATE_256 bit will always be set and iterate256 optimization will be disabled. Pertains to GFX10 only
Settings.Name: DisableIterate256Opt

Settings.Description: If true, allow depth copy resolve.
Settings.Name: AllowDepthCopyResolve

Settings.Description: If true, depth compression will be enabled.
Settings.Name: DepthCompressEnable

Settings.Description: If true, stencil compression will be enabled.
Settings.Name: StencilCompressEnable

Settings.Description: If true, DB preloading will be enabled.
Settings.Name: DbPreloadEnable

Settings.Description: If true, DB preload window dimensions will be used instead of the depth buffer's dimensions.
Settings.Name: DbPreloadWinEnable

Settings.Description: If true, per-tile tracking of exp/clear will be enabled.
Settings.Name: DbPerTileExpClearEnable

Settings.Description: If true, hierarchical depth testing will be enabled.
Settings.Name: HiDepthEnable

Settings.Description: If true, hierarchical stencil testing will be enabled.
Settings.Name: HiStencilEnable

Values.Description: 256-bit request size.
512-bit request size.

Settings.Description: Specifies the DB read request size.
Settings.Name: DbRequestSize

Settings.Description: Controls the DB_RENDER_OVERRIDE2.DISABLE_COLOR_ON_VALIDATION register field
Settings.Name: DbDisableColorOnValidation

Values.Name: OutOfOrderPrimDisable
Values.Description: Always disable.

Values.Name: OutOfOrderPrimSafe
Values.Description: Enable when known to not affect render output.

Values.Name: OutOfOrderPrimAggressive
Values.Description: Enable when suspected to not affect render output.

Values.Name: OutOfOrderPrimAlways
Values.Description: Always enable.

Settings.Description: Enable out-of-order primitive mode. Only available on parts that have more than one VGT.
Settings.Name: EnableOutOfOrderPrimitives

Values.Description: Values are log(2) of the watermark.

Settings.Description: The watermark value for out-of-order primitives.
Settings.Name: OutOfOrderWatermark

Settings.Description: If true, disables vertex grouping specified in GE_CNTL register for Gfx10+ ASICs by setting VERT_GRP_SIZE to 256.
Settings.Name: DisableGeCntlVtxGrouping

Settings.Description: If true, disables the PA broadcast of prims that touch adjacent screen tiles to help check PA output rate.
Settings.Name: DisablePaBroadcast

Settings.Description: If true, the HW-GS stage will prefer to send a wave to each SIMD in a CU before moving to the next enabled CU. If false, HW-GS prefers to send only one wave to each CU before moving to the next enabled CU.
Settings.Name: GsCuGroupEnabled

Values.Description: Must be 128 dword aligned.

Settings.Description: Maximum amount of LDS space to alloc for each on-chip GS subgroup, in DWORDs.
Settings.Name: GsMaxLdsSize

Settings.Description: Controls the value for late-alloc GS.
Settings.Name: LateAllocGs

Values.Name: LateAllocVsBehaviorLegacy
Values.Description: Enable late-alloc vs, but incorrectly masks off CUs in dynamic mode

Values.Name: LateAllocVsBehaviorDynamicEnableAllCus
Values.Description: Enable late-alloc vs, but don't mask off CUs

Values.Name: LateAllocVsBehaviorDisabled
Values.Description: Disable late-alloc vs entirely

Settings.Description: Controls the behavior for late-alloc VS.
Settings.Name: LateAllocVs

Settings.Description: Clamps the maximum tessellation factor.
Settings.Name: MaxTessFactor

Settings.Description: Controls the number of patches-per-thread-group to run when tessellationis enabled. This value is normally limited by hardware resources (LDS,TFBuffer, Threads). - Setting to 1 will always work, but is slowest. - Setting to 0 will allow the driver to choose the optimal value. - Any other value will be used (clamped based on HW resources). Offchip Tess rounds this to the nearest multiple of four.
Settings.Name: NumTessPatchesPerThreadGroup

Settings.Description: Number of primitives sent to one VGT before switching to the next. Valid range is 1-65536, values larger than 256 are expected to hurtperformance. This setting only affects non-tessellation and non-NGG pipelines.
Settings.Name: PrimGroupSize

Settings.Description: If true, RbPlus will be enabled for ASIC of RbPlus capability.
Settings.Name: RbPlusEnable

Settings.Description: Value to program the number of cache lines for SPI_SHADER_LATE_ALLOC_VS to. The range is [0, 63]. The default value of 255 changes to (numCUs/SA - 1) * 4.

Values.Description: Number of cache lines to program SPI_SHADER_LATE_ALLOC_VS to.

Settings.Name: Gfx10SpiShaderLateAllocVsNumLines

Settings.Description: Value to program GE_PC_ALLOC::NUM_PC_LINES to for legacy and NGG-passthru pipelines. The value in this setting is per shader-engine. The driver multiplies this value by the number of shader engines and then subtracts 1.
Settings.Name: Gfx10GePcAllocNumLinesPerSeLegacyNggPassthru

Settings.Description: When TRUE, stops the driver from disabling any CUs/WGPs to avoid an NGG deadlock. Typically the driver disables 1 CU on GFX9 and 1 WGP on GFX10. It is up to the user to avoid any dead locks. This can be done by disabling late alloc.
Settings.Name: AllowNggOnAllCusWgps

Settings.Description: Value to program GE_PC_ALLOC::NUM_PC_LINES to for NGG-culling pipelines. The value in this setting is per shader-engine. The driver multiplies this value by the number of shader engines and then subtracts 1.
Settings.Name: Gfx10GePcAllocNumLinesPerSeNggCulling

Settings.Description: When value is greater than zero, then it specifies the number of PS waves to be soft grouped.
Settings.Name: NumPsWavesSoftGroupedPerCu

Settings.Description: When value is greater than zero, then it specifies the number of VS waves to be soft grouped.
Settings.Name: NumVsWavesSoftGroupedPerCu

Settings.Description: If true, the HW will alternate VGT's between draws rather than between sets of primitives within a draw. True is safer, but less performant.
Settings.Name: SwitchVgtOnDraw

Settings.Description: Vertex walking pattern for tessellation: 0: (default) Donut walking pattern for optimal reuse. 1: Single-ring walking pattern, has suboptimal reuse.
Settings.Name: TessWalkPattern

Settings.Description: If true, offchip tessellation will always use the maximum number ofLDS buffers possible (based on Chip ID).
Settings.Name: UseMaxOffchipLdsBuffers

Settings.Description: Load half-packed VS waves, forcing them to use half as much space in the param cache at the expense of inefficient use of ALU resources, if the export count is >= this threshold. This can help performance in some cases.
Settings.Name: VsHalfPackThreshold

Settings.Description: If true, forces the VGT to issue a VS wave as soon as a primgroup isfinished.
Settings.Name: VsForcePartialWave

Settings.Description: Current recommendation from the hardware team is to force PA_SC_CONSERVATIVE_RAST_CNTL.COVERAGE_AA_MASK = 0
Settings.Name: DisableCoverageAaMask

Settings.Description: True forces a BATCH_BREAK event when a new pixel shader is bound. False by default.
Settings.Name: BatchBreakOnNewPixelShader

Settings.Description: True forces a 'clear_state' command to initialize the context registers to a known state. False will only write the essential subset of registers.
Settings.Name: UseClearStateToInitialize

Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided GS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for GS waves.
Settings.Name: GsCuEnLimitMask

Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided VS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for VS waves.
Settings.Name: VsCuEnLimitMask

Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided PS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for PS waves.
Settings.Name: PsCuEnLimitMask

Settings.Description: This mask is AND-ed with the driver-decided CS-specific CU_EN mask to further allow limiting of enabled CUs for CS waves.
Settings.Name: CsCuEnLimitMask

Settings.Description: This contains the value that will be set for SPI_GS_THROTTLE_CNTL1. The default value is overridden in gfx9SettingsLoader.cpp with the loaded ASIC's default value. Manual setting takes precedence over the ASIC's default value.'
Settings.Name: DefaultSpiGsThrottleCntl1

Settings.Description: This contains the value that will be set for SPI_GS_THROTTLE_CNTL2. The default value is overridden in gfx9SettingsLoader.cpp with the loaded ASIC's default value. Manual setting takes precedence over the ASIC's default value.
Settings.Name: DefaultSpiGsThrottleCntl2

Values.Description: Primitive group size.

Settings.Description: This controls the value that will be set for the GFX11 specific GE_CNTL::PRIM_GRP_SIZE. Number of primitives in a primgroup. This will be used by Assembler to create primgroups. Valid values are 1-256. The value written to this register field will be this key's value divided by PRIM_AMP_FACTOR. Default to 252 to leave space for a null token broadcast for 2 subgroups in an attribute group.
Settings.Name: Gfx11GeCntlPrimGrpSize

Values.Name: Gfx11GeCntlGcrModeDefault
Values.Description: No override - driver will select optimal GCR mode.

Values.Name: Gfx11GeCntlGcrModeEnabled
Values.Description: Force GCR enabled (GCR_DISABLE=0).

Values.Name: Gfx11GeCntlGcrModeDisabled
Values.Description: Force GCR disabled (GCR_DISABLE=1).

Settings.Description: This controls the GCR(Graphics Cache Rinse) usage through GFX11 specific GE_CNTL::GCR_DISABLE.
Settings.Name: Gfx11GeCntlGcrMode

Values.Name: Rsrc4GsThrottlePhEn
Values.Description: Whether to enable PH_THROTTLE in SPI_SHADER_PGM_RSRC4_GS.

Values.Name: Rsrc4GsThrottleSpiEn
Values.Description: Whether to enable SPI_THROTTLE in SPI_SHADER_PGM_RSRC4_GS.

Settings.Description: Bitmask of cases where GS wave throttling will be used
Settings.Name: Rsrc4GsThrottleEn

Settings.Description: This contains the size in bytes that we will allocate for attributes through memory. Maximum value is 16MB for the entire chip. The value will 64KB aligned. This value is in bytes. NOTE: If key is not set, default value can vary per ASIC (e.g. Gfx11+ APU default is 512 KiB).
Settings.Name: Gfx11VertexAttributesRingBufferSizePerSe

Settings.Description: If true, preamble will start pipeline stats and subsequent pipeline queries will be ignored. If false, preamble will not issue any pipeline stats, and a subsequent UniversalCmdBuffer::AddQuery() call with QueryPoolType::PipelineStats will start stats again.
Settings.Name: EnablePreamblePipelineStats

Values.Name: Gfx11OreoModeBlend
Values.Description: Pipeline is in blend mode (fail-safe that should work for all cases).

Values.Name: Gfx11OreoModeOpaqueThenBlend
Values.Description: Pipeline operates in Opaque mode unless overridden by register state back to Blend mode (should be the most performant).

Values.Name: Gfx11OreoModePunchoutThenOpaqueThenBlend
Values.Description: Pipeline operates in Punchout mode unless reg fallback to Opaque then Blend mode.

Settings.Description: Enum to control how the OREO feature works.
Settings.Name: Gfx11OreoModeControl

Settings.Description: If true, disables falling back to blend mode when OREO_MODE = 1 (Gfx11OreoModeControl = 1).
Settings.Name: Gfx11ForceOreoMode

Settings.Description: If true, forces DB to make every wave conflict with the prior wave..
Settings.Name: Gfx11ForceExportOrderControl

Settings.Description: Maximum shader prefetch size in bytes.  Set arbitrarily large to use driver default.  Set to zero to disable
Settings.Name: ShaderPrefetchSizeBytes

Settings.Description: Specifies the number of entries in the DrawData and PayloadData shader rings for Task and Mesh shaders, per SE. Must be a power-of-2.
Settings.Name: NumTsMsDrawEntriesPerSe

Settings.Description: Whether or not PAL supports NGG. For quality purposes only.
Settings.Name: NggSupported

Settings.Description: Overrides the default value for late-alloc GS for NGG pipelines. Must be set to greater than -1 to take effect and max value must not be greater than 127.
Settings.Name: OverrideNggLateAllocGs

Settings.Description: Controls the minimum batch bin size used.
Settings.Name: MinBatchBinSize

Structure.Description: Minimum batch bin size width.  Value must be a power-of-two between 16 and 512.  Set to 0 to use default limit.
Structure.Name: Width

Structure.Description: Minimum batch bin size height.  Value must be a power-of-two between 16 and 512.  Set to 0 to use default limit.
Structure.Name: Height

Settings.Description: If true, ignore Depth when calculating bin size if Color is bound.
Settings.Name: IgnoreDepthForBinSizeIfColorBound

Settings.Description: The value to program to PA_SC_BINNER_CNTL_0::BINNING_MODE when the driver disables binning. Valid values are 2 and 3.
Settings.Name: DisableBinningMode

Settings.Description: Maximum amount of parameter storage per batch when not using NGG. The maximum is value 128. Zero means calculate an optimal value based on the hardware configuration. On GFX9, this value is in units of 2 param cache lines..
Settings.Name: BinningMaxAllocCountLegacy

Settings.Description: Maximum amount of parameter storage per batch when using NGG with the on-chip parameter cache. Any negative value means calculate an optimal value based on the hardware configuration. 0 means unlimited except on GFX9 and GFX10, where it also chooses an optimal value. On GFX9, this value is in units of 2 param cache lines.
Settings.Name: BinningMaxAllocCountNggOnChip

Settings.Description: Maximum number of FPOV tokens allowed per batch. Zero means no limit.
Settings.Name: BinningFpovsPerBatch

Settings.Description: Value for the PA_SC_BINNER_CNTL_1::OPTIMAL_BIN_SELECTION register field.
Settings.Name: BinningOptimalBinSelection

Settings.Description: Number of RBs to use in bin size calculations. A value of zero means use the number of RBs on the HW. GFX10 and later only
Settings.Name: BinningBinSizeRbOverride

Settings.Description: Number of pipes to use in bin size calculations. A value of zero means use the number of pipes on the HW. GFX10 and later only
Settings.Name: BinningBinSizePipesOverride

Settings.Description: If true, disable Binning when the PS uses UAV append or consume
Settings.Name: DisableBinningAppendConsume

Settings.Description: Use this prefetch method when the client sets prefetchShaders on a graphics command stream.

Values.Name: PrefetchDisabled
Values.Description: Never prefetch.

Values.Name: PrefetchCpDma
Values.Description: Use CP DMA to stream data into the L2.

Values.Name: PrefetchPrimeUtcL2
Values.Description: Just prime the UTCL2, not the data L2.

Settings.Name: ShaderPrefetchMethodGfx

Settings.Description: Use this prefetch method when the client sets prefetchShaders on an async compute command stream.

Values.Name: PrefetchDisabled
Values.Description: Never prefetch.

Values.Name: PrefetchCpDma
Values.Description: Use CP DMA to stream data into the L2.

Values.Name: PrefetchPrimeUtcL2
Values.Description: Just prime the UTCL2, not the data L2.

Settings.Name: ShaderPrefetchMethodAce

Settings.Description: Use this prefetch method when the client sets prefetchCommands on a graphics command stream.

Values.Name: PrefetchDisabled
Values.Description: Never prefetch.

Values.Name: PrefetchCpDma
Values.Description: Use CP DMA to stream data into the L2.

Settings.Name: CommandPrefetchMethodGfx

Settings.Description: Use this prefetch method when the client sets prefetchCommands on an async compute command stream.

Values.Name: PrefetchDisabled
Values.Description: Never prefetch.

Values.Name: PrefetchCpDma
Values.Description: Use CP DMA to stream data into the L2.

Settings.Name: CommandPrefetchMethodAce

Settings.Description: Controls whether anisotropic filtering optimizations are enabled.
Settings.Name: AnisoFilterOptEnabled

Settings.Description: Controls whether the round-up logic for samplers is enabled.
Settings.Name: CeilingLogicEnabled

Settings.Description: Controls whether rounding of values coming out of the normalizer is enabled.
Settings.Name: SamplerPrecisionFixEnabled

Settings.Description: Controls the value of the PERF_MIP field in Sampler SRD's.
Settings.Name: SamplerPerfMip

Settings.Description: Controls the value of the anisotropy threshold for Sampler SRD's.
Settings.Name: SamplerAnisoThreshold

Settings.Description: Controls the value of the anisotropy bias for Sampler SRD's.
Settings.Name: SamplerAnisoBias

Settings.Description: Controls the value of the secondary anisotropy bias for Sampler SRD's.
Settings.Name: SamplerSecAnisoBias

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then non-TS events will be replaced with their corresponding TS event
Settings.Name: WaReplaceEventsWithTsEvents

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then a SQ_NON_EVENT will be added to the postabmle of graphics command buffers
Settings.Name: WaAddPostambleEvent

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then PA_SU_LINE_STIPPLE_CNTL.LINE_STIPPLE_RESET will be set to 2 for all non-stipple draws
Settings.Name: WaLineStippleReset

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then AUTO_FLUSH_MODE settings will be inverted.
Settings.Name: WaAutoFlushModePolarityInversed

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then only those mips up to and including the first mip in the mip tail will be compressed.
Settings.Name: WaRestrictMetaDataUseInMipTail

Values.Name: NoFix
Values.Description: UAV stencil writes occur with no workaround

Values.Name: GraphicsCopies
Values.Description: If set, image-to-image copies will always use a graphics copy

Values.Name: ReCopyVrsData
Values.Description: If set, copies will occur as normal but the VRS data will be marked as dirty and will be fixed on the next draw

Settings.Description: Shader writes to UAV stencil surfaces will corrupt any associated hTile data.
Settings.Name: WaVrsStencilUav

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then non-copy ROP3 will disable the DCC overwrite combiner.
Settings.Name: WaLogicOpDisablesOverwriteCombiner

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then rotated swizzle modes will disable the DCC overwrite combiner.
Settings.Name: WaRotatedSwizzleDisablesOverwriteCombiner

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then disabling fMask compression also sets the DISABLE_FMASK_NOFETCH_OPT bit.
Settings.Name: WaDisableFmaskNofetchOpOnFmaskCompressionDisable

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then vrs with depth stence exports will be disabled.
Settings.Name: WaDisableVrsWithDsExports

Settings.Description: Fixes issues related to unexposed MSAA samples.
Settings.Name: WaFixPostZConservativeRasterization

Settings.Description: Fixes issues related to invalid values associated with VGT_TESS_DISTRIBUTION.
Settings.Name: WaClampQuadDistributionFactor

Settings.Description: Controls whether the workaround waWrite1xAASampleLocationsToZero is active. FALSE:   Forces the workaround off. TRUE:    Forces the workaround on. Not Set: Allows the driver to decide, based on Chip ID.
Settings.Name: WaWrite1xAASampleLocationsToZero

Settings.Description: The overwrite combiner marks something as overwritten even if there are ensuingquads to the same sector that need dest
Settings.Name: WaColorCacheControllerInvalidEviction

Settings.Description: This workaround forces hTile data to be Z-only for images with multiple mip levels.
Settings.Name: WaForceZonlyHtileForMipmaps

Settings.Description: The overwrite combiner takes only the target mask into consideration while decidingto overwrite combine whereas the other parts of the CB decide on shader mask andtarget mask. This discrepancy may lead to the overwrite combiner incorrectly signalinga read optimization when shader and target mask are different
Settings.Name: WaOverwriteCombinerTargetMaskOnly

Settings.Description: Controls if hTile prefetch is disbled.
Settings.Name: WaDisableHtilePrefetch

Settings.Description: Controls if STALLED_POPS is used or not.
Settings.Name: WaMiscPopsMissedOverlap

Settings.Description: Controls if whenever a context roll is detected whether the scissor registers will be rewritten.
Settings.Name: WaMiscScissorRegisterChange

Settings.Description: Controls if a PS_PARTIAL_FLUSH is used whenever the scissor top-left or bottom-right registers change.
Settings.Name: WaMiscPsFlushScissorChange

Settings.Description: If set, hTile buffers support non-zero pipe-bank xor values.
Settings.Name: WaHtilePipeBankXorMustBeZero

Settings.Description: If set PAL will not set 24_8 hw format for 24-32bit converted depth surfaces, this will fix fast clear expansion with TC compatible surfaces (but also return incorrect unclamped border color.)
Settings.Name: WaDisable24BitHWFormatForTCCompatibleDepth

Settings.Description: On Gfx9, the DB can delay tile write requests in such a way that its pending write ack counters can underflow while processing EOP timestamps. The workaround is to issue a ZPASS_DONE event before each timestamp event because it will add pending writes which are lower priority than the tile writes so they will fence the delayed writes. Defaults to TRUE for Gfx9, FALSE for others.
Settings.Name: WaDummyZpassDoneBeforeTs

Settings.Description: On Gfx9, the meta-addressing equation can theoretically map multiple pixels to the same This fix prevents that from happening.  Meta-equation generated by driver must match the meta equation as generated by the silicon.  Products that do not have the fix have no HW configurations that expose the problem.
Settings.Name: WaMetaAliasingFixEnabled

Settings.Description: If set, align image allocation size up to fragment size when Cmask is present, but continue to issue GCN ranged syncs operations using the original, unpadded size.
Settings.Name: WaCmaskImageSyncs

Settings.Description: If set, SDMA can not access meta-data (compression) surfaces.
Settings.Name: WaSdmaPreventCompressedSurfUse

Settings.Description: If set, PAL will insert a VGT_FLUSH between a pipeline transition from a NGG to a legacy GS.
Settings.Name: WaVgtFlushNggToLegacyGs

Settings.Description: If set, PAL will insert a VGT_FLUSH between a pipeline transition from a NGG to a legacy pipeline.
Settings.Name: WaVgtFlushNggToLegacy

Settings.Description: If true, enables prefetching of Index buffer pages prior to draws in NGG piplines.
Settings.Name: WaEnableIndexBufferPrefetchForNgg

Settings.Description: If true, enables Z16_UNORM 1xAA uninitialized decompress hang workaround.
Settings.Name: WaZ16Unorm1xAaDecompressUninitialized

Settings.Description: If true, forces LateAllocGs to always be 0.
Settings.Name: WaLateAllocGs0

Settings.Description: If true, whenever an index buffer is bound with zero size we instead bind an internal index buffer with a single zero entry to prevent a hang in the GE.
Settings.Name: WaIndexBufferZeroSize

Settings.Description: If true, whenever a POPS (Primitive Order Pixel Shader) pipeline is bound, we need to set DB_RENDER_OVERRIDE2::PARTIAL_SQUAD_LAUNCH = PSLC_ON_HANG_ONLY to prevent a hang..
Settings.Name: WaStalledPopsMode

Settings.Description: If true, IB2's cannot be used on the constant engine (CE).
Settings.Name: WaCeDisableIb2

Settings.Description: If true, disable stencil compression for ZS images for which a stencil only depth target could be created
Settings.Name: WaDisableSCompressSOnly

Settings.Description: If true, instance packing will be disabled when query pipeline statistics  using *_ADJACENCY primitive and instance > 1.
Settings.Name: WaDisableInstancePacking

Settings.Description: If true, disable GRBM Register stalling for SQTT
Settings.Name: WaNoSqttRegStall

Values.Name: Gfx10VrsHtileEncodingTwoBit
Values.Description: Two bit hTile encoding of VRS data

Values.Name: Gfx10VrsHtileEncodingFourBit
Values.Description: Four bit hTile encoding of VRS data

Settings.Description: Controls whether hTile will use two bit or four bit encoding of VRS shading rate
Settings.Name: VrsHtileEncoding

Settings.Description: Controls FORCE_VRS_RATE_FINE setting.  False means to use the VRS rate generated by VRS rate combiners as shading rate; true forces VRS rate to 1x1 if the rate generated by rate combiners is coarse rate
Settings.Name: VrsForceRateFine

Settings.Description: The device owns a depth buffer used for VRS data storage in the event of the app not binding their own depth buffer.  If this setting is true, then the depth buffer is hTile only; otherwise, it also contains a stencil plane.
Settings.Name: PrivateDepthIsHtileOnly

Settings.Description: If true, NULL source images are handled by modifying the combiner state.  False causes the depth buffer to be updated
Settings.Name: OptimizeNullSourceImage

Settings.Description: Controls the size of the VRS image that is always allocated by PAL whether VRS is used or not. The high 16 bits are the height of the image and the low 16 bits are the width. A size of 0 will have undefined behavior for any app that uses VRS image combiners.
Settings.Name: VrsImageSize

Settings.Description: If true, prevents enabling BIG_PAGE for resources that could share a 64KiB memory region with a non-BIG_PAGE resource.
Settings.Name: WaUtcL0InconsistentBigPage

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, then 4x MSAA Depth/Stencil surfaces will set the number of z planes for decompress to 2 in order to avoid a hang associated with setting iterate_256 to 1.
Settings.Name: WaTwoPlanesIterate256

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, when legacy tessellation is enabled with wireframe mode, we need to disable vertex reuse or suffer corruption.
Settings.Name: WaTessIncorrectRelativeIndex

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled and NGG is enabled we need to limit LATE_ALLOC_GS to <= 64.
Settings.Name: WaLimitLateAllocGsNggFifo

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, we need to clamp GE_CNTL::VERT_GRP_SIZE to avoid a hang due to an issue in PC space allocation.
Settings.Name: WaClampGeCntlVertGrpSize

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, ignore thread-trace finish results and flush the pipe instead due to RB harvesting issues.
Settings.Name: WaBadSqttFinishResults

Settings.Description: If the workaround is enabled, we to issue a VGT_FLUSH between legacy GS pipelines that have different VGT_GS_MODE::CUT_MODE values.
Settings.Name: WaLegacyGsCutModeFlush

Values.Name: Gfx10SdmaBypassMallOnRead
Values.Description: Use MALL for SDMA read access

Values.Name: Gfx10SdmaBypassMallOnWrite
Values.Description: Use MALL for SDMA write access

Values.Name: Gfx10SdmaBypassMallOnDefault
Values.Description: Use MALL in default settings

Settings.Description: Bitmask of cases where SDMA accesses will bypass the MALL
Settings.Name: SdmaBypassMall

Settings.Description: Enables the mall cursor cache option
Settings.Name: EnableMallCursorCache

Settings.Description: Determines if GFX or Compute is used to fast clear SingleSampled DepthStencil surfaces. Value is in units of (pix width x height x depth). Values <= this will take GFX else Compute.
Settings.Name: DepthStencilFastClearComputeThresholdSingleSampled

Settings.Description: Determines if GFX or Compute is used to fast clear MultiSampled DepthStencil surfaces. Value is in units of (pix width x height x depth). Values <= this will take GFX else Compute.
Settings.Name: DepthStencilFastClearComputeThresholdMultiSampled

Settings.Description: This value is used to program PA_SC_NGG_MODE_CNTL::MAX_FPOVS_IN_WAVE. When the number of FPOVs in a wave exceeds MAX_FPOVS_IN_WAVE, the next FPOV would break wave. Legal values are 0 to 255.

Values.Description: 1 FPOV will break the wave.
Number of FPOVs * 2 that will break the wave.

Settings.Name: Gfx10MaxFpovsInWave

Settings.Description: If we should use EOP timestamp waits on ACE engines instead of CS_PARTIAL_FLUSH events. This is intended as a debug switch.
Settings.Name: DisableAceCsPartialFlush

Settings.Description: Override the value of GB_ADDR_CONFIG sent to the address library with this value. This setting is intended for Architecture Modeling purposes only and cannot be safely modified. 0 means do not override
Settings.Name: AddrLibGbAddrConfigOverride
Gfx102NonLocalDestPreferCompute
Settings.Description: Prefer compute for non-local copies on gfx10.2+. This can increase PCIe throughput.

Settings.Name: Gfx103PlusDisableAsymmetricWgpForPs
Settings.Description: On WGP harvesting asymmetric configuration, we scan all of the SAs to find the minimal number of WGPs to override the psCuEnLimitMask setting for performance.

Settings.Name: EnableHoleyOptimization
Settings.Description: Enable the 'holey' optimization to minimize CP overhead. Unnecessary for ASICs running F32 cores.

Settings.Name: Gfx11EnableContextRegPairOptimization
Settings.Description: Optimize draw launch rate by enabling use of SET_CONTEXT_REG_PAIR_PACKED packets. GFX11 specific and overridden to true unless this setting is explicitly set to false.

Settings.Name: Gfx11EnableShRegPairOptimization
Settings.Description: Optimize draw launch rate by enabling use of SET_SH_REG_PAIR_PACKED packets including compute on graphics user data. GFX11 specific and overridden to true unless this setting is explicitly set to false.

Settings.Name: Gfx11EnableShRegPairOptimizationCs
Settings.Description: Optimize draw launch rate by enabling use of SET_SH_REG_PAIR_PACKED packets for compute on ace. GFX11 specific and overridden to true unless this setting is explicitly set to false.

Settings.Name: Gfx11EnableZpassPacketOptimization
Settings.Description: Reduce RS64 CP overhead by writing a simplified EVENT_WRITE packet, EVENT_WRITE_ZPASS. GFX11 specific and overridden to true unless this setting is explicitly set to false.
Perfcounter workaround which samples all counters in the running state if SQ counters are on.
Settings.Name: WaNeverStopSqCounters

Settings.Description: This WA fixup the SQG TT WPTR field to be the correct offset value for the case that the WPTR field stores the actual address that write pointer is at.
Settings.Name: WaSqgTtWptrOffsetFixup

Settings.Description: This WA fixup a Navi3x CB perfcounter hardware bug, which will cause CB counters stuck at 0 if PERFCOUNTER_STOP is received. If enabled, PAL will remove use of PERFCOUNTER_STOP.
Settings.Name: WaCbPerfCounterStuckZero

Settings.Description: WA to force PRE_PIX_SHADER barrier sync point for PWS+.
Settings.Name: WaForcePrePixShaderWaitPoint

Settings.Description: WA to force LOCK*THRESHOLD for HS, GS, and CS to 0.
Settings.Name: WaForceLockThresholdZero

Settings.Description: WA to force SPI_GS_THROTTLE_CNTL2.SPI_THROTTLE_MODE != 0.
Settings.Name: WaForceSpiThrottleModeNonZero

Settings.Description: Set VS_XY_NAN_TO_INF = 0 to disable PA stereo rendering
Settings.Name: WaSetVsXyNanToInfZero

Settings.Description: Set DB_RENDER_CONTROL.MAX_ALLOWED_TILES_IN_WAVE one smaller due to incorrect calculation in the DB cachelines.
Settings.Name: WaIncorrectMaxAllowedTilesInWave
